intro: Ruilopezia bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Ruilopezia bracteosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
